info.comment: Field is only completed if the project is staged otherwise it will be empty
info.description: Stage refers to Staged TEC – how much TEC the Customer will connect and when.  The customer may choose to bring on capacity in chunks to align with their build /commissioning program.  Staged contracts are also used when a customer may only be able to bring on a proportion of their total capacity at a particular point in time ahead of further reinforcement works being carried out, completion of which would allow the remaining TEC onto the system.
info.title: Stage

info.comment: Field will state 0MW until the project is built and connected
info.description: Amount of capacity currently connected to the National Grid
info.title: MW Connected

info.comment: Field will state 0MW unless the TEC is due to increase or decrease
info.description: Amount of capacity contracted to connect or be removed at a future date
info.title: MW Increase/Decrease

info.description: Total amounty of capacity contracted across all Stages
info.title: Cumulative Total Capacity (MW)

info.comment: Field will only include dates for future connections or increase/decreases to TEC, otherwise this field will be empty
info.description: Date on which Connection is contracted to be effective from
info.title: MW Effective From

info.comment:
"The Status classifications are very much based on information we have either ascertained from the customer or from another source, i.e. government website.  It’s important to note that we hold no authority on the Status classifications on Registers and are produced on an “as far as we are aware” basis.

To this end we deem the classifications to mean:

Scoping – we are not aware that a planning application has been made
Awaiting Consents – we are aware (or the customer has told us) a planning application has been made
Consents Approved – we are aware (or the customer has told us) the planning application has been approved"
info.description: Indicates what stage the Project is at in it's build cycle
info.title: Project Status

info.description: Indicates if the project is connecting directly to the National Grid or if the connection is embedded
info.title: Agreement Type

info.description: Indicates which TO is resposible for the connection
info.title: HOST TO

info.description: Indicates the fuel type contracted to connect
info.title: Plant Type

info.comment: Please note this ID Reference is case sensitive
info.title: Project ID

info.comment: If there is more than one Stage the Project number will be followed by a dash and the relevant stage number.
info.title: Project Number

info.comment: The value in this field is only completed once a signed Gate 1 or Gate 2 contract is countersigned - until that point all existing contracted projects will appear blank
info.description: Indicates which Gate the Project is contracted at
info.title: Gate
